Package org.jtrim2.event

Interface SimpleListenerRegistry<ListenerType>

Type Parameters:
ListenerType - the type of the event listeners can possibly be added to the container
All Known Subinterfaces:
ListenerManager<ListenerType>, ListenerRegistry<ListenerType>
All Known Implementing Classes:
CopyOnTriggerListenerManager, OneShotListenerManager, ProxyListenerRegistry
public interface SimpleListenerRegistry<ListenerType>
Defines the interface to register event listeners to be notified later in an implementation dependent way. It is possible to add and remove listeners to and from the collection concurrently anytime.

This interface defines similar functionality to the class java.awt.AWTEventMulticaster but allows for more efficient implementations and also more generic (can be used with any kind of listeners, not just AWT). The most notable difference is the way of removing registered listeners: While with usual AWT listeners one must invoke a removeXXX method with the registered listener instance, this interface returns a reference when registering a listener and this reference can be used to remove the registered listener. The method provided is safer to use and usually more convenient, since lots of different reference of different listener registrations can be grouped and be removed in a single loop rather than having a distinct way of removing every different listener.

Notice that this interface does not define how events can be triggered, for typical event triggering mechanism see the ListenerManager interface.

Thread safety

Implementations of this interface are required to be safe to use by multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

Implementations of the methods of this interface must be synchronization transparent.
See Also:

    ListenerRef
    registerListener(ListenerType listener)
    Adds an event listener to this container and returns a reference which can later be used to removed the listener added.

  • Method Details

    • registerListener

      ListenerRef registerListener(ListenerType listener)
      Adds an event listener to this container and returns a reference which can later be used to removed the listener added.

      Subsequent event notifications will notify the added listener unless it is removed using the returned reference.

      It doesn't matter if the listener was already added. In case the given listener have been added to this ListenerRegistry it will be added again causing the added listener to be notified as many times as it has been added. Note that the equals method of the listener should have no effect regarding this ListenerRegistry.

      If a listener is removed but it was added multiple times, it will be removed only once. So, further event notifications will be delivered to the listener one less time.

      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to be added to this container and be notified in subsequent event notifications method calls. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the reference which can be used to remove the currently added listener. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified listener is null
